page.title: 08BUILDINGS IN OGBOURNE
page.content: {Ogbourne St Andrew}seems to have changed very little in the past few hundred years.The village still lacks many basic public services and amenities and compared with Marlborough has few new buildings. Evidence of the early life of the village is in the beautiful 800 year old{church}which has a well preserved appearance though is being repaired. {Houses}are mostly old, though there are a few built more recently including several council houses. Many old houses have kept their individual characters with moss and ivy covered walls and thatched roofs.Some of them show signs of restoration, renovation and even modernisation.Other buildings include a 400 year old{forge,}a small private{primary school,}a{post office and a local{pub.}On the outskirts stand old barns and farm buildings.
